sentences.en: And take heed that thou come at my first call. "
sentences.cn: 留点心,我一叫你就回来. ”

sentences.en: Chris would have been well advised to heed the old saying "Never bite the hand that feeds you."
sentences.cn: 克里斯本应听从那句老话——“千万不要恩将仇报”。

sentences.en: Environmental problems pay no heed to these geographic lines.
sentences.cn: 环境问题并不理会这些地理界限.

sentences.en: He pays too much heed these days to my nephew Tom, and Tom is no great thinker.
sentences.cn: 他最近过分重视我侄子汤姆的话了，而汤姆根本不是什么伟大的思想家。

sentences.en: He takes no [ little ] heed of what others say.
sentences.cn: 他不 [ 很少 ] 留意别人的话.

sentences.en: I cautioned him many times but he paid no heed.
sentences.cn: 我多次劝告,他都置若罔闻.

sentences.en: If she had only heeded my warnings , none of this would have happened.
sentences.cn: 要是她当初听从我的警告，这一切都不会发生。

sentences.en: Listen to both sides and you will be enlightened , heed only one side and you will be benighted.
She takes no heed of what is said.
That was a very astute observation. I shall heed it.
sentences.cn: 这段评语很敏锐, 今后我得注意才是.

sentences.en: The cover, which had already heed roughly fitted into position, was now hammered down.
sentences.cn: 盖子已大致放在要钉的位置上了, 用锤子把钉子钉牢.

sentences.en: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
sentences.cn: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。

sentences.en: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
sentences.cn: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

sentences.en: We must heed the correct views, and act upon them.
sentences.cn: 对正确的意见必须听, 并且照它做.

sentences.en: You must take heed of what he has told.
sentences.cn: 你要注意他所告诉的事.

words.tran_cn: 注意的；深切注意的；深切留心的
掉以轻心地；不加注意地

trans.tran_en: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning
